snippet: While the numbers are still well below what they were at the height of the war, strikes against Islamic State and Taliban targets increased in June.
abstract: American military has expanded airstrikes in Afghanistan, including new campaign against Islamic State; intensification of strikes by drones and warplanes comes six months after Pres Obama's declaration that combat mission in country had ended.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jawad Sukhanyar, Fazal Muzhary and Mujib Mashal from Kabul, and Khalid Alokozay from Nangarhar Province, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: While the numbers are still well below what they were at the height of the war, strikes against Islamic State and Taliban targets increased in June.

headline.main: U.S. Steps Up Airstrikes in Afghanistan, Even Targeting ISIS
headline.print_headline: U.S. Increases Airstrikes in Afghanistan on Taliban and Its New Rival, ISIS

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
